summary: The document details the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records, focusing on the appointment of George Robert Blakey as Chief Counsel and Director, including his salary and the authorization process. It also discusses the partial postponement of the document's release due to privacy concerns related to Social Security numbers and includes a memorandum requiring staff to disclose any relationships to current Members of Congress.
key_findings: The document is related to the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
George Robert Blakey was appointed as Chief Counsel and Director with a gross annual salary of $27,000.60.
The release of the document was partially postponed due to privacy concerns regarding Social Security numbers.
Staff were required to disclose any familial relationships to current Members of Congress as outlined in a memorandum.
